title: Data Analyst
description:
OverviewThis is a junior data analyst who will play a key role supporting the organization's data-driven initiatives. This role will work closely with IT functional teams, supply chain business partners, and other cross-functional teams to collect, process, analyze, and visualize data to provide valuable insights and analytics that contribute to tactical and strategic decision-making. Specifically, this role will support the FLNA manufacturing business function to include 38 manufacturing plants across US and Canada, 200 processing lines, 1900 packaging linesResponsibilitiesGather, cleanse, model, interpret and present data-based recommendations to solve business problemUnderstand data governance methodologies and assist the data team with data governance and data modeling activitieCreate visualizations, such as charts and graphs, and write reports or summaries, that effectively present information to relevant stakeholderDocument data flow diagrams and provide guidance and recommendations on how we can improve data flows between systemSolve data-related issues and complete adhoc and planned data query requestsCompensation & Benefits:The expected compensation range for this position is between $66,300 - $111,000 based on a full-time scheduleLocation, confirmed job-related skills and experience will be considered in setting actual starting salary Bonus based on performance and eligibility; target payout is 5% of annual salary paid out annuallyPaid time off subject to eligibility, including paid parental leave, vacation, sick, and bereavementIn addition to salary, PepsiCo offers a comprehensive benefits package to support our employees and their families, subject to elections and eligibility: Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability, Health and Dependent Care Reimbursement Accounts, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Insurance (Accident, Group Legal, Life), Defined Contribution Retirement QualificationsBachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field2+ years in a data related role or academic programProficiency in database, data manipulation and analysis using tools like SQL and PythonFamiliarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).Data cleaning and reprocessing tools and techniquesMachine learning basics and algorithmsExpert in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint applicationsStrong critical thinking, problem solving, and curiosityExcellent communication and collaboration skills and be able to present complex data insights in a clear and understandable mannerEagerness to learn and adapt in a fast-paced, collaborative environmentStrong business acumen and be able to articulate how their work is aligned with organizational goals and prioritiesEffective time management skillsHigh attention to detailEEO StatementAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability statusPepsiCo is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Female / Minority / Disability / Protected Veteran / Sexual Orientation / Gender IdentityIf you'd like more information about your EEO rights as an applicant under the law, please download the available EEO is the Law & EEO is the Law Supplement documents. View PepsiCo EEO PolicyPlease view our Pay Transparency Statement

title: Data Analyst
description:
About UsDailymail.com is the world’s largest English-language newspaper website with over 200 million monthly unique visitors. Our teams across the globe strive to provide our readers with engaging, fast and rolling news, 24/7, 365 days a year. With over 360 journalists worldwide we are seeking individuals who have an interest in joining a global media organization with excellent career development opportunities. Dailymail.com is seeking a a dedicated and dynamic Data Analyst who will play an integral role in powering data-driven decision-making across the organization.Key ResponsibilitiesData Infrastructure Management: Develop, operate, and maintain our data pipeline, data infrastructure, and reporting systems to inform critical business decisions.Dashboard Creation: Design and upkeep data visualization dashboards that grant access to essential data for various stakeholders.Data Integrity: Conduct regular data accuracy checks and resolve discrepancies to ensure the robust health of our data systems.Performance Analysis: Evaluate the efficiency and output of our commercial activities against crucial performance indicators.Revenue Optimization: Continuously analyze performance across multiple platforms, delivering inventive recommendations to internal teams aimed at enhancing performance and unlocking new revenue streams.Cross-Functional Collaboration: Engage in multidisciplinary projects, utilizing superior data modelling and analytics to glean insights that influence strategy and identify areas for improvement.Team Interaction: Collaborate closely with departments including Operations, Sales, Marketing, Finance, and Analytics to deliver exceptional customer service aligned with the objectives of DailyMail.com.Required Experience & SkillsBachelor’s degree in a quantitative or technical field such as Math, Engineering, Statistics, or Computer Science.Proficiency in Excel, SQL, Python, and Tableau is essential.Strong quantitative aptitude coupled with a creative, autonomous approach to problem-solving.Ability to work constructively in a team setting.Excellent project management abilities and multitasking skills to meet deadlines.Preferred QualificationsExperience in digital media and ad-tech sectors is a significant advantage.Familiarity with tools such as Airflow, Scala, Spark, PowerBI, Snowflake, and Java.Proficiency in Google Cloud Suite (Storage, Big Query, Compute Engine, Kubernetes Engine) and AWS (EC2, Redshift).

title: Data Analyst
description:
Location: Melbourne FL, United States of AmericaThales people architect solutions that enable two-thirds of planes to take off and land safely. We create in-flight entertainment systems that engross 50 million fliers every year and we develop the avionics that control the world’s largest commercial aircrafts. Our simulators train the next generation of pilots for fighter jets, transporters and search and rescue helicopters. And, together, each and every member of our aerospace team makes a difference.When you rely on airlines to connect you in flight, you rely on Thales. In an increasingly fast paced world, we make the unpredictable, predictable by connecting and entertain passengers to make your life better. Combining a diversity of talents, we master the decisive moments that matter to passengers and airlines. Whatever it takes.Data AnalystOrlando OR Melbourne, FL USA | (Hybrid)Position SummaryThales is looking for a Data Analyst to independently collaborate with designated global clients to craft and deliver contractual and system monitoring reports. These reports, essential for the Programs and Field Service teams, encompass diverse metrics such as Sales, Revenue Performance, System Availability, Dispatch Availability, and System Reliability. Your autonomy extends to working closely with departmental leaders and Data Miners, ensuring the accuracy of extracted datasets from aircraft systems and effectively visualizing report data through advanced business intelligence tools.In this position, you will act as a liaison and subject matter expert for the Operations Performance Reporting Team, you will play a pivotal role in generating ad-hoc reports tailored for the In-Service, Field Service, and Programs teams around the globe. This involves being able to determine priority for multiple deliverables and completing all items within allotted time allowed, highlighting your autonomous decision-making and strategic contribution to the broader business objectives.You will display Flexibility in Task Assignments by demonstrating adaptability and willingness to undertake additional tasks as directed by the department managers and leaders, showcasing a proactive and resourceful approach.This role, success hinges upon being proactive, resourceful, and fostering a collaborative environment while effectively collaborating with team members to achieve shared goals.Key Areas of ResponsibilityDeliver Production Reports to Customers by utilizing Thales System Performance Reporting Tools to independently manage the process of uploading crucial data onto Thales System Performance Reporting tools to generate comprehensive reports.Extracting and Modeling Data: Expertly extracting data from Thales tools and data warehouses, employing advanced data modeling techniques to format and present data for insightful review and analysis.Generating Contractual KPI Reports: Proficiently using Thales Business Intelligence Software to produce detailed and accurate contractual Key Performance Indicator (KPI) reports.Collaboration with Field Service Teams: Actively communicating and collaborating with Field Service teams to identify and address any anomalies or discrepancies in the data.Presenting Findings: Conveying recurring discoveries or indicators of suboptimal performance to Field Service and In-Service Engineering teams for thorough investigation and resolution.Support or Enhancement of Reporting Tools through identifying issues and opportunity for enhancements: Working closely with departmental leadership to pinpoint and resolve issues associated with existing reporting tools, contributing to their enhancement and optimization and Alpha User for Testing and Validation through Assuming the role of an Alpha User to rigorously test, validate, and review process flows for new reporting tools, ensuring their seamless integration and functionality.Minimum QualificationsA Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field, demonstrating a strong foundation in analytical and technical competencies is preferred.Candidates lacking a Bachelor's degree may have at least 5 years of practical hands-on experience in a relevant field, particularly in production reporting of operational performance indicators or related roles. This substantial experience should showcase a comprehensive understanding and proficiency equivalent to that acquired through formal education.A minimum of 1 year of hands-on experience in meticulously handling production reporting of operational performance indicators, showcasing a practical understanding of data analysis and reporting.Demonstrated knowledge and proficiency in using a variety of Business Intelligence Tools such as Crystal Reports, SQL Server Reporting Services, Tableau, PowerBI, or similar platforms. The ability to effectively leverage these tools to extract, analyze, and visualize data is essential.Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite tools, including Outlook, Word, Excel, etc., showcasing adeptness in handling data, creating reports, and communicating findings effectively.If you’re excited about working with Thales, but not meeting the requirements for this position, we encourage you to join our Talent Community!Special Position RequirementsSchedule: Core Business Hours Monday-Friday 8am – 5pm, etc.Travel: Travel as needed for workshops, training, or team development.Physical Environment: General Office Environment, Repair Center, and Distribution Center.Physical Demands: Standard Office Workspace Environment, including handling of general office equipment and working in or around the distribution center.Regulatory Compliance Requirements: None.What We OfferThales provides an extensive benefits program for all full-time employees working 30 or more hours per week and their eligible dependents, including the following:Elective Health and Dental plans. Retirement Savings Plan with a company contribution and a match, and without vesting period. Company paid holidays, vacation days, and paid sick leave. Company provided Life Insurance.Why Join Us?Say Hi and learn more about working at Thales click here.This position will require successfully completing a post-offer background check. Qualified candidates with [a] criminal history will be considered and are not automatically disqualified, consistent with federal law, state law, and local ordinances.Successful applicant must comply with federal contractor vaccine mandate requirements.Thales champions inclusion and we believe diversity strengthens the fabric of our culture. We are an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.If you need an accommodation or assistance in order to apply for a position with Thales, please contact us at talentacquisition@us.thalesgroup.com.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Management Resources is seeking a highly skilled Data Analyst/Data Scientist to join our team for a critical project. In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing large datasets, extracting meaningful insights, and providing actionable recommendations to support key business initiatives. The ideal data analyst will use their passion for analytics to provide insights to our client covering a wide range of topics. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users.  ResponsibilitiesCompile and analyze data related to business' issuesDevelop clear visualizations to convey complicated data in a straightforward fashionAnalyze complex datasets to identify trends, patterns, and correlations.Develop predictive models and algorithms to optimize business processes and drive decision-making.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and define analytical objectives.Interpret and communicate findings to stakeholders through clear and compelling visualizations and presentations.Continuously monitor and evaluate model performance, making adjustments as necessary to ensure accuracy and relevance.QualificationsBachelor's degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, or a related field; master's degree preferred.Proven experience in data analysis, statistical modeling, and machine learning techniques.Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with meticulous attention to detail.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with team members and stakeholders.

title: Data Analyst
description:
RemoteBluehawk Consulting is seeking a Data Analyst to support our client, an aerospace leader. Our client is making space travel possible, and your work will directly support putting people, research, and products safely in space.Project OverviewOur client’s Product Cost Management (PCM) team works with a cross functional team to establish, define, and maintain cost estimates for Product Lifecycle including production, support, and operation. Cost estimates are composed of material and labor for components and assemblies aggregated using indented bill of materials. PCM utilizes multiple methods and data sources to develop and manage these cost estimates.PCM requires assistance with data analytics which can be used for cost comparisons and reporting. The vendor team supporting this effort is composed of data analyst with a blend of business analysis, data analysis and data visualization skills.ResponsibilitiesOrganize, document, and report the cost data in multiple cross functional reports. Create and deploy queries, conduct data analysis, and produce reports and presentations to share critical insights with stakeholders. Oversee data migration or verify the accurate exchange of information between databases or systems. Develop analytical models that display trends and historical data to provide insights for cost improvement. Maintain the cross functional estimate data sharing across client’s systems. Required Skills & ExperienceMust be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum. Must be proficient at utilizing Excel and Tableau (Formulas, Tables, Pivots, Charts, etc.) Our Diverse and Inclusive Culture Bluehawk Consulting is a Kirkland, Washington-based management consulting firm helping Fortune 500 clients improve their performance, increase their efficiency, and enhance organizational value while reducing costs.We are a team who love to accomplish great things together!We excel at hiring talented people who are driven to create solutions for our client’s most challenging projects. Uniting amazing talent with meaningful work experiences is our passion; fostering an environment that embraces individuality and unique gifts embodies our values and fuels our purpose.We ValueOur diverse team, they make us great! Consultative, client-focused and interactive approaches Innovation, actualizing potential, and a positive outlook towards change and accepting challenges Learning, listening, and communicating openly with respect Passion, energy, zeal - we have lots of it Humor, lightness, and flexibility We care about creating a supportive environment and positive employee experience. Employees will receive competitive pay, health insurance, including medical, dental, and vision coverage (choose between our Base Plan with HSA or Buy-up PPO plan), 401(k) with company match, 12 paid holidays, and up to 15 days of paid time off (PTO) per year. We also offer life insurance and a short-term disability benefit.Salary Range for this position: $86,000 - $95,000Bluehawk is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.If this sounds like a place you'd like to learn more about, visit us at www.bluehawkconsulting.com

title: Data Analyst (Superset)
description:
Title: Data Analyst (Superset)Reporting to: Managing Director, Data Science & Analytics / Head Data ScientistLocation: This is a remote / work from home positionOpportunity:The Data Analyst role will be responsible for ongoing and retrospective analyses of product and provider data, generating insights and creating custom data reports to evaluate the current state of patient experiences and outcomes, as well as to inform future opportunities. In conjunction with the Client Success team, the Data Analyst will be responsible for developing data frameworks; creating stories with data that review critical business processes; monitoring and reporting on progress at client sites; and performing investigations that inform operational changes and shape the vision of the team. Additionally, the Data Analyst role will work closely with the product and engineering teams to maintain and improve Get Well’s Business Intelligence (BI) capabilities. In particular, the Data Analyst will coordinate with engineers and product team members to ensure that Get Well’s data architecture and practices are aligned with the needs and goals of Client Success, and Get Well’s evolving technology platform.Responsibilities:Collect, analyze, and generate weekly/monthly data and reports for individual client sites, demonstrating current and cumulative performance Acquire, sanitize, merge, and transform complex multi-sourced data in support of various analyses and projects In conjunction with the Client Success team, review reporting processes, create and maintain dashboards and tools to track and inform team metrics across multiple client sitesModel Get Well’s core values of empathy and service to build trusted partnerships with provider organizations in order to achieve transformative change and exceptional performanceContinually iterate and improve Get Well’s service offering through genuinely innovative and transformative insight and product developmentRequirements:Bachelor’s degree in mathematics, science, statistics, or related fieldExpert skills in a Business Intelligence Platform - Superset strongly preferred but Tableau, Power BI, Looker, etc are acceptable - including at least one year of professional experience in manipulating data and creating dashboards and visualizationsStrong competency with SQL queryingStrong competency in Python or R is a plusCompetency with Google Sheets or Microsoft Excel, including pivot tables and advanced formulasEntrepreneurial mindsetStrong analytical skills with a proven ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of informationAn exceptionally high attention to detail, natural curiosity, and an eye for recognizing trends and gaps2-3 years of industry relevant experience in analytics, data management, healthcare, consulting, or other relevant fieldsAbility to adapt to changing priorities and juggle multiple asksSelf-driven and able to operate with a high degree of independence and integrityExcellent written and oral presentation skills, with the ability to engage, inspire, build credibility and engender trust across all levels of an organizationAbout Get Well:We are a global digital health company with more than 20 years of experience improving patient engagement. Through partnerships with some of the most progressive hospitals and health systems in the world, we use digital technology to improve the healthcare experience for patients, their families, and clinicians.The estimated pay scale for this position is between $70,000 and $82,000 in base salary, plus annual bonus potential of 10%. Base salary is dependent upon many factors including, but not limited to, education, experience, and skills and this range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. In addition to compensation, Get Well offers a comprehensive benefit package, 401K and incentive plans, open paid-time away, paid leave programs, wellness reimbursement, cell phone subsidy, peer recognition programs, health advocacy and employee assistance programs, pet insurance, and so much more.Get Well is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age or veteran status.Powered by JazzHRYx7jqyzhn5

title: Data Analyst
description:
About Us:Zealthy is a telemedicine company on a mission to provide critical healthcare services to all who need them. We seek to build the world's largest and highest quality telemedicine company and fundamentally expand access to high-quality care.While the Founder was most recently Founder and CEO at a unicorn healthcare company where he scaled to hundreds of thousands of patients, the full-time team is currently only 10 people. The company is focused on sustainable growth, and the company is growing quickly to achieve its mission.We work hard at Zealthy to ensure that patients can access high-quality healthcare from anywhere. This means working Monday-Friday in the office. Hours tend to be longer than at most companies because we work hard to serve our patients and make sure that we can achieve our mission of building the world's largest and highest quality telemedicine company.The culture is focused on what we can do to serve our patients and all full-time members of the team will be equity holders in the business, as we firmly believe that all team members should be literal and figurative owners in what we are building.We are currently seeking a full-time Data Analyst. Please note that this position will start out in person in our Miami Beach office, and then transfer to our NYC office once it opens.What You’ll Do:Set up initial data stack for the team.Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets to extract meaningful insights. Utilize statistical methods to interpret data trends and patterns.Create clear and concise reports and dashboards to communicate data-driven insights to various stakeholders.Ensure data accuracy and reliability by developing and implementing data quality checks. Identify and address data discrepancies or anomalies.Create clear and concise reports and dashboards to communicate data-driven insights to various stakeholders.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and provide analytical support for decision-making. Identify opportunities for improvements and optimizations.Develop and implement predictive models to forecast trends and support future business planning. Continuously refine and enhance models based on feedback and evolving business needs.Discover hidden patterns and trends within large datasets to inform strategic business decisions.Conduct exploratory data analysis to uncover insights and opportunities.What You’ll Bring:Must have experience with SQL.Bachelor's degree in a related field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related quantitative discipline.At least of 1 year of experience in management consulting, investment banking, data, or at a startup.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with attention to detail.Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey complex findings in a clear and understandable manner.Familiarity with database management and data warehousing concepts.Knowledge of statistical methods and predictive modeling techniques.

title: Data Analyst
description:

Position: Data AnalystCompany: Tree of WallyLocation: RemoteJob Type: Volunteer (unpaid for now)Commitment: Up to youWe are looking for a data analyst with experience in visual presentation, data analysis, economics, project management, entrepreneurship, and systems of value. title: Data Analyst
description:
Manhattan, New York, USAHybrid (2 days in office)Pelago is the world’s leading virtual clinic for Substance Use Management. Our program provides guidance, support and treatment for members seeking to overcome their tobacco, alcohol and opioid use. From unhealthy habits to active substance use disorders, Pelago delivers a personalized solution based on individual health, habits, genetics, and goals, providing care for members wherever they might be on the substance use spectrum.Pelago's suite of virtual services ranges from education, to cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) to comprehensive medication-assisted treatment (MAT).Pelago enables employers and health plans to deliver accessible, affordable, and effective treatment for substance misuse.With deep insights into our program performance, we see data as the strategic key to unlock our next wave of growth and innovation, and help millions of people manage their substance use. The Data team is integral to Pelago’s growth success, shaping the company’s culture of data-driven decision making and innovative use of data in product, client and member experience. As a multi-disciplinary team of analysts, engineers and scientists, the data team is nimble and innovative in delivering data architecture, reporting and analytics solutions to propel the company forward.As a Data Analyst, you’ll work cross-functionally with stakeholders across the organization to deeply understand requirements and capture insightful reports and analyses. You’ll be part of a growing team, with opportunities to contribute towards team strategy and stretch your skillset. This will be a hybrid role, located within commutable distance to our NYC office for weekly lunches, collaboration, and teamwork.Responsibilities:Partner with cross-functional stakeholders to define key performance indicators, measure performance and provide insights and actionable recommendations from analyses conductedDevelop and maintain best in class dashboards using design best practices to monitor KPIs, surface trends, and guide stakeholders in their day to day decision makingBuild SQL queries to conduct thorough analysis of stakeholders blindspots to answer key questionsIdentify data gaps in the data teams internal database and collaborate with engineers to ensure gaps are resolved to meet the businesses needsAssist in data governance to ensure data is of the highest quality. This includes identifying errors in code, surfacing data anomalies, and building accurate dashboards/reportsWork with stakeholders to precisely define business requirements. These requirements should be translated into technical requirements to be used by the internal data teamThe background we are looking for:You have been working for 2+ years in a data function (as an analyst strongly preferred)You have extensive experience with data discovery using SQLYou have experience building dashboards using BI platforms such as Tableau, PowerBI, Qlikview or LookerYou have strong expertise in requirements gathering to translate them into usable dashboardsYou have experience guiding stakeholders with what metrics will be most meaningful to themYou have extreme attention to detail to ensure quality data solutions are being deliveredYou have excellent communication skills specifically understanding who your audience is and providing the correct level of details appropriate. IE: Speaking with executives vs an internal data engineerYou have worked in a fast-paced agile environment. Experience with Jira is a strong plusExperience and familiarity working with healthcare data and data sets, preferredFamiliarity with DBT is a plusThe provided range reflects our US target salary range for this full-time position, which is part of our broader total compensation package, including stock options, comprehensive benefits, and incentive pay applicable to eligible roles. Individual pay within the range will vary based on a variety of factors like role-related experience and education, internal pay equity, and other relevant business factors. At Pelago, we are committed to an equitable and fair pay philosophy and review total compensation for our employees at least twice a year.

products and developing tools and models for forecast and valuationThe position maintains the existing data science models and provides detailed report on model results timely and accuratelyThe title: SQL Data Analyst
description:
Our client a leading asset management firm, located in New York City is looking to hire a SQL Data Analyst.  As a Data Analyst, your primary focus will be to develop and execute a comprehensive data strategy, establish robust data governance practices, and ensure efficient reporting solutions within our organization. You will play a pivotal role in shaping the data landscape, enabling data-driven decision-making, and optimizing data assets to drive business success. You will also work closely with the business to understand their data requirements and deliver solutions to support their needs. This is a Full Time Position. Citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor currently. Qualified candidates should send their resumes (Word Format) along with salary expectations to  careers@velocitysgi.com .RESPONSIBILITIES Design and implement a forward-looking data strategy that aligns with the organization's business objectives, incorporating industry best practices and emerging data technologies.Define and maintain a scalable, efficient, and flexible data architecture that accommodates diverse data sources and formats, while enabling seamless data integration and access. Work closely with business stakeholders to align architecture with their requirements.Design and develop robust ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to efficiently move, cleanse, and transform data from various sources into a central data repository, meeting business needs.Implement and manage master data management solutions to ensure data consistency, accuracy, and reliability across the organization, in collaboration with various departments.Collaborate with business stakeholders to define reporting requirements and deliver business intelligence and reporting solutions that provide actionable insights. Work closely with various departments to understand their reporting needs.Establish data quality standards, conduct data profiling, and implement data quality improvement processes to maintain data integrity, with consideration for business-specific data quality requirements.Create and maintain comprehensive documentation of data assets, data flows, and data definitions, making it accessible to relevant business teams.Continuously assess emerging data technologies and tools to keep the organization up-to-date and competitive.Design and implement databases to reflect new and existing business requirements.Evaluate current data designs and databases to determine needed, upgrades and improvements.Design and automate various internal and external reports using SSRS, InDesign and Power BI.Communicate with many different company stakeholders to assess needs and goals.Interpret functional and business requirements, design and implement solutions and architecture suited to our current business model and enhance them.  QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Information Systems, or a related field.2+ years working experience in IT at Financial Institutions.3+ years full stack development of enterprise applications and database solutions.Hands on experience with SQL Server, Azure, SSRS, Power BI.Experience in data architecture, data strategy, data governance, and reporting.In-depth knowledge of database management systems, data modeling, ETL processes, and reporting toolsExcellent communication and interpersonal skills for collaboration with cross-functional teams and stakeholdersKnowledge of industry best practices and data management trendsSkills and Abilities:Knowledge of business domain is recommended.Proficiency in Azure data services and technologies.Strong understanding of data architecture, data modeling, and data governance principles.Knowledge of ETL processes and tools, particularly within the Azure ecosystem.Experience with master data management (MDM) and data quality management.Expertise in data reporting and analytics tools, especially those integrated with Azure.In-depth knowledge of data security and compliance, including Azure security practices.Excellent documentation and communication skills.Expertise in T-SQL and SQL Server Data Management Services (SSMS), SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS)Solid knowledge of T-SQL (SQL Server) which includes stored procedures, UDF's and query optimization.Solid knowledge of ETL, SSRS and Power BI.Experience in T-SQL, SSRS, Power BI and SQL Server database management system.Good understanding of Azure environment and DevOps.InDesign Automation a plus.Salary 100-120k

title: Data Analyst
description:
OverviewPepsiCo operates in an environment undergoing immense and rapid change. Big-data and digital technologies are driving business transformation that is unlocking new capabilities and business innovations in areas like eCommerce, mobile experiences and IoT. The key to winning in these areas is being able to leverage enterprise data foundations built on PepsiCo’s global business scale to enable business insights, advanced analytics and new product development. PepsiCo’s Data Management and Operations team is tasked with the responsibility of developing quality data collection processes, maintaining the integrity of our data foundations and enabling business leaders and data scientists across the company to have rapid access to the data they need for decision-making and innovation.What PepsiCo Data Management and Operations does:Maintain a predictable, transparent, global operating rhythm that ensures always-on access to high-quality data for stakeholders across the companyResponsible for day-to-day data collection, transportation, maintenance/curation and access to the PepsiCo corporate data asset Work cross-functionally across the enterprise to centralize data and standardize it for use by business, data science or other stakeholdersIncrease awareness about available data and democratize access to it across the company Job DescriptionAs a Data Analyst, you will be the key domain expert overseeing PepsiCo's business process and drive a strong discussion for how Supply Chain, Financial, Consumer, Channel, Category business needs to be defined and prioritize by working very closely with business leads, data science team and data engineering team. You'll develop an in-depth understanding of business processes in and translate business requirements to data engineering team in technical way.ResponsibilitiesDiscover, analyze, and scope data requirements & representing them in conceptual and logical data modelsGather and analyze data pertaining to various business processes such as forecasts, capital requirements, inventory, logistic, manufacturing and production capacity to develop supply chain models. geographics, POS, pricing and promotion, store profile, e-commerce data to develop channel models.Discover, analyze, and scope data requirements & representing them in conceptual and logical data modelsCreate high-level process models (system interface diagrams, workflow & swim lane diagrams, data flow diagrams) to represent processes for the area under analysisEmpower the business by creating value through the increased adoption of data, data science and business intelligence landscapeResponsible to improve the quality of data in relation to defined expectationsPerform analysis of system data to identify patterns, exceptions, and erroneous dataCompensation and Benefits:The expected compensation range for this position is between $75,000 - $127,500 based on a full-time schedule.Location, confirmed job-related skills and experience will be considered in setting actual starting salary.Bonus based on performance and eligibility; target payout is 5% of annual salary paid out annually.Paid time off subject to eligibility, including paid parental leave, vacation, sick, and bereavement.In addition to salary, PepsiCo offers a comprehensive benefits package to support our employees and their families, subject to elections and eligibility: Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability, Health and Dependent Care Reimbursement Accounts, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Insurance (Accident, Group Legal, Life), Defined Contribution Retirement Plan.Qualifications2+ years of experience with data analysis & data profiling in project, business requirements definition or data engineering in CPG or Manufacturing Industry.1+ years’ work experience in the areas of Distribution Network Analysis, Manufacturing, Production Network Optimization, Transportation, Demand Planning, or other areas related to Supply Chain or other domains such as Financial, Consumer, Channel, Category etc.1+ years of strong Data Profiling experience & ability to identify trends and anomalies in the data to in-form data model build out.Experience in working with Datasets from POS Aggregators such as IRI, Nielsen, Kantar etc.Experience working with structured/unstructured datasets, ability to clearly document and communicate requirement to technical team members.Experience with Business Intelligence tools, SQLTools. EducationBachelor’s Degree in Business Analytics is required. CompetenciesStrong knowledge and understanding of SC data elements and processes per the necessary in-scope data domain (i.e. Customer, Material, Vendor)Ability to translate business requirements into critical data dependencies and requirementsAble to challenge and align various stakeholders to a common set of standards Self-starter with excellent written & verbal communication skills.EEO StatementAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.PepsiCo is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Female / Minority / Disability / Protected Veteran / Sexual Orientation / Gender IdentityIf you'd like more information about your EEO rights as an applicant under the law, please download the available EEO is the Law & EEO is the Law Supplement documents. View PepsiCo EEO Policy.Please view our Pay Transparency Statement

title: Data Analyst
description:
Title: Data AnalystLocation: Remote (EST/CST preference)Full-Time Direct Hire W2U.S. Citizenship or Valid Green Card RequiredThe Data Analyst will work within their team and in collaboration with business stakeholders to determine reporting requirements. They will serve as the liaison between business and technology to bridge the gap for understanding the overall business goal and value with currently available and new data assets. They will work with the business to establish financial and operational success metrics, determine baselines to define post-go-live implementation success, and track metrics during pilot and scaling of different programs. The Data Analyst will support the team with planned and ad-hoc analyses of internal datasets, as well as some external datasets and digital solutions to support decision-making within the team.Essential Responsibilities:Partners with the Customer Success Property Systems Team to complete discovery, define scope, and develop custom client reports ensuring timely delivery and accurate presentation of data.Determine business team reporting needs, working with business and technology / data stakeholders to gather requirements, and determine current data availability, and feasibility.Validate identified datasets for accuracy through analysis and coordination with data engineering teams.Design pilot measurement plans by working with technology teams to ensure data flows are established.Synthesize existing data for team ideation and prioritization sessions and leverage with team in solution design.Partners with operations leaders to communicate insights and recommendations based on data.Contribute to building measurement and analytics expertise, tools, and processes in-house to enable high-quality analytics across the data team members.Knowledge, Skills, Abilities:Academic background in a quantitative or related field (e.g., Analytics, Applied Mathematics, Economics, Statistics)Experience with visualization tools, such as Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, etc.Experience building and manipulating data models within Power BI, using DAX and SQL to massage datasets into a usable state for visualizationExperience or interest in using Python, R, or other programming languages for data wrangling, automation, and machine learning (e.g., classification, clustering, response prediction, sentiment analysis, A/B testing)Experience understanding, processing, analyzing, visualizing, and communicating complex data sets to technical and non-technical audiences, tailoring your message to show business value and impact by understanding the goal and your audienceExperience designing statistically valid experiments to test and prove hypotheses, understanding the difference between correlation and causation to help drive the business forward without making unnecessary assumptionsExperience or understanding of Agile product development and design thinking to execute based on defined timelinesAbility to operate efficiently in a remote working environment through proper organization, communication, and execution to meet the business needs – prior remote working experience a plus

title: Data Analyst, HR Technology
description:
Meta’s People Data Solutions team is seeking an experienced Data Analyst to provide technical solutions for the HR Technology data ecosystems. You’ll be responsible for developing data products such as statistical models and forecasts, complex queries, and Tableau dashboards. You will also play a consultative role where you will guide partners and stakeholders in defining metrics, interpreting data visualizations, and interpreting results of analysis. You will also be responsible for upkeep and maintenance of existing products, which may require deep dive analysis to validate data quality, integrity, and accuracy of enterprise data solutions. As with any role with Meta, flexibility as we adopt changes as the business needs to transform.To be successful in this role, you'll have a passion for data, the ability to manage multiple projects concurrently, and enjoy a fast-moving organization. You’ll identify ways to tell a compelling story with data and strong design principles. You will thrive within cross-functional teams, excel at building and managing relationships with internal partners and stakeholders, and exhibit excellent organizational and presentation skills. Creativity, optimism, and out-of-the-box thinking are encouraged.Data Analyst, HR Technology Responsibilities:Build rich and dynamic dashboards using out-of-box features, customizations, and visualizations using Tableau and SQLExplore and recommend emerging technologies and techniques to support/enhance BI landscape componentsParticipate in the ongoing development of the business intelligence and data solution ecosystem within the wider organizationProvide summary documentation on all analysis results to stakeholders, XFNs, or LeadershipUncover gaps in current insight tools, integrate new analytics and tracking solutions to surface dataLeverage tools such as SQL, Tableau, Workday, and Excel to drive analytics and enable client self-service on routine queriesAct as an internal consultant by understanding business needs, scoping data requests, synthesizing insights, and recommending solutions to key business partnersApply expertise in quantitative analysis and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and help inform, influence, support, and execute our business decisionsCollaborate with cross-functional partners to execute and deliver scalable solutions, while influencing roadmap goalsMinimum Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree4+ years’ reporting and analytics experienceExperience working in a quick changing environmentExperience to manipulate, store, and report on data via Excel and/or SQLExperience using visualization tools (e.g., Tableau) to communicate and present insightsExperience in building relationships and collaborating within a cross-functional teamPreferred Qualifications:Degree in a quantitative field, such as Applied Statistics, Mathematics, Finance, Statistics, Economics, Operations Research, or Information SystemsExperience with HR and Recruiting dataOutstanding organizational, time management, and communication skills Strong presentation skillsExperience dealing with ambiguity, needs to understand and react quickly to changing priorities even when not all the information is availableAbout Meta:Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Role Name - Regulatory Data AnalystRegulatory Data Analyst to help manage current product and regulatory compliance data and documentation by product, considering current and future key global regulatory requirements.The Regulatory Data Analyst will collaborate closely with regulatory and data analyst personnel to coordinate and integrate data and create key data visualization outputs.Our mission is to elimination of hazardous substances, improved material and energy efficiency, as well as design for environment.We believe that major improvements in environmental performance will be delivered through product design innovations.The analyst will support with data collection, verification and preliminary review of compliance documentation.The analyst will utilize program management skills to track and operate multiple data projects across coinciding timelines.Experience with product lifecycle management (PLM) systems and Bills of Material (BOM)Knowledge on global regulations RoHS, REACH, Full Material Declaration (FMD), VOC and PFAS, experience in managing product compliance data collection preferredExperience in data analysis project operationsProficient with managing, analyzing, and synthesizing large datasetsExperience with Javascript and Python preferredAdvanced MS Excel skills required, experience with Tableau or other reporting and/or visualization tools preferred

title: Analyst, Data Analytics & eDiscovery
description:
Location: DFW Headquarters Building 8 (DFW-SV08)Additional Locations: NoneRequisition ID: 71819IntroAre you ready to explore a world of possibilities, both at work and during your time off? Join our American Airlines family, and you’ll travel the world, grow your expertise and become the best version of you. As you embark on a new journey, you’ll tackle challenges with flexibility and grace, learning new skills and advancing your career while having the time of your life. Feel free to enrich both your personal and work life and hop on board!Why you'll love this jobThis position provides a unique opportunity to assist our e-discovery and legal operations teams with data analytics and visualization as well as perform substantive tasks for both functions. You will have the opportunity to work with our attorneys, legal support staff, and technologists in a dynamic environment in which initiative and creativity are highly valued.This role is part of our Legal team within our Corporate Affairs division.What You'll DoUse existing software platforms to preserve and collect Company data.Track various projects for quality control purposes and to ensure timely completion.Provide periodic reporting on e-discovery and legal operations performance statistics.Work across functional teams to define and develop analytics and reporting requirements.Create dashboards using data expressions & visualizations which are aligned to strategic goals and operational initiatives.Define and implement data querying expressions and techniques.Manipulate and analyze complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources (internal and external) using a variety of tools and data analysis techniques.Custom report building, including the ability to identify the location of data points from various applications and produce meaningful reports.Assist Legal Department personnel with use of visualization tools and software platforms.All you'll need for successMinimum Qualifications - Education & Prior Job ExperienceBachelor's degree in Management Information Systems, Data Analytics, Data Science, Information Design, Computer Science or related discipline, or equivalent work experience2+ years of experience designing and developing visualization solutions using PowerBI, Tableau, or equivalent enterprise data visualization softwareAdvanced Excel skillsPreferred Qualifications - Education & Prior Job ExperienceExperience using Service Now as a project management platformPower Automate, Low Code – No Code programmingMicrosoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Vision) experience and strong understanding of data relationshipsWorking knowledge of large data manipulation and data miningSkills, Licenses & CertificationsAbility to create and edit complex Power BI dashboards and reportsExceptional problem solving technical and data analysis skillsDemonstrated judgment, personal integrity, and interpersonal skillsExcellent communications (written and oral), interpersonal, and problem-solving skills with a track record as a problem solver and an effective team playerProven ability to build and facilitate relationships at all levels of the organization, both internally and externallyAbility to consult with peers and management and collaborate on the best solution to be implementedStrong organization, time management and task prioritization skillsOutstanding communications skills with both technical and non-technical colleaguesAbility to manage multiple projects simultaneously to meet objectives and key deadlinesAbility to work in a team environment that promotes collaborationWhat You'll GetFeel free to take advantage of all that American Airlines has to offer:Travel Perks: Ready to explore the world? You, your family and your friends can reach 365 destinations on more than 6,800 daily flights across our global network.Health Benefits: On day one, you’ll have access to your health, dental, prescription and vision benefits to help you stay well. And that’s just the start, we also offer virtual doctor visits, flexible spending accounts and more. Wellness Programs: We want you to be the best version of yourself – that’s why our wellness programs provide you with all the right tools, resources and support you need.401(k) Program: Available upon hire and, depending on the workgroup, employer contributions to your 401(k) program are available after one year.Additional Benefits: Other great benefits include our Employee Assistance Program, pet insurance and discounts on hotels, cars, cruises and more.Feel free to be yourself at AmericanFrom the team members we hire to the customers we serve, inclusion and diversity are the foundation of the dynamic workforce at American Airlines. Our 20+ Employee Business Resource Groups are focused on connecting our team members to our customers, suppliers, communities and shareholders, helping team members reach their full potential and creating an inclusive work environment to meet and exceed the needs of our diverse world.Are you ready to feel a tremendous sense of pride and satisfaction as you do your part to keep the largest airline in the world running smoothly as we care for people on life’s journey? Feel free to be yourself at American.Additional Locations: NoneRequisition ID: 71819
